protocol.name: P-AFFY-2
protocol.text: Labeling of samples was carried out according to the manufacturer’s standard protocol

protocol.name: P-MTAB-1228
text: Seed material for growth experiments was derived from plants grown in parallel under identical conditions. Plants were established in soil (type ‘GS-90 Einheitserde’, Gebrüder Patzer, Germany). Firstly, seeds were allowed to germinate and grow for two weeks in controlled growth chambers (7 days: 16 h light [140 µmol m-2 s-1], 20°C, 75 % relative humidity/8-h night, 6°C, 75 % relative humidity; thereafter 7 days: 8 h light [140 µmol m-2 s-1], 20°C, 60% relative humidity/16-h night, 16°C, 75% relative humidty). Subsequently, plants were transferred to long-day conditions in a greenhouse with artificial light (16 h light [high pressure sodium and metal halide lamps], 21°C, 50 % relative humidity/8 h night, 19°C, 50 % relative humidity). Both genotypes were grown in the same chamber at the same time in a randomized manner.
(Parameters: time unit = seconds, temperature unit = C)

protocol.name: P-MTAB-1229
protocol.text: Wild-type and exo plants were grown in a randomized manner in a greenhouse. Above ground organs of 15 plants per genotype were harvested for preparation of one RNA sample.
